background.name: Acolyte
entries: You devoted yourself to service in a temple, either nestled in a town or secluded in a sacred grove. There you performed rites in honor of a god or pantheon. You served under a priest and studied religion. Thanks to your priest's instruction and your own devotion, you also learned how to channel a modicum of divine power in service to your place of worship and the people who prayed there.

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Calligrapher's Supplies|XPHB}, {@item Book|XPHB|Book (prayers)}, {@item Holy Symbol|XPHB}, {@item Parchment|XPHB} (10 sheets), {@item Robe|xphb}, 8 GP; or (B) 50 GP

background.name: Artisan
entries: You began mopping floors and scrubbing counters in an artisan's workshop for a few coppers per day as soon as you were strong enough to carry a bucket. When you were old enough to apprentice, you learned to create basic crafts of your own, as well as how to sweet-talk the occasicriul demanding customer. Your trade has also given you a keen eye for detail.

items.name: Tool Proficiency:
items.entry: Choose one kind of {@item Artisan's Tools|XPHB}

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Artisan's Tools|XPHB} (same as above), 2 {@item Pouch|XPHB|Pouches}, {@item Traveler's Clothes|XPHB}, 32 GP; or (B) 50 GP

background.name: Charlatan
entries: Once you were old enough to order an ale, you soon had a favorite stool in every tavern within ten miles of where you were born. As you traveled the circuit from public house to watering hole, you learned to prey on unfortunates who were in the market for a comforting lie or two—perhaps a sham potion or forged ancestry records.

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Forgery Kit|XPHB}, {@item Costume|XPHB}, {@item Fine Clothes|XPHB}, 15 GP; or (B) 50 GP

background.name: Criminal
entries: You eked out a living in dark alleyways, cutting purses or burgling shops. Perhaps you were part of a small gang of like-minded wrongdoers who looked out for each other. Or maybe you were a lone wolf, fending for yourself against the local thieves' guild and more fearsome lawbreakers.

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Dagger|XPHB|2 Daggers}, {@item Thieves' Tools|XPHB}, {@item Crowbar|XPHB}, {@item Pouch|XPHB|2 Pouches}, {@item Traveler's Clothes|XPHB}, 16 GP; or (B) 50 GP

background.name: Entertainer
entries: You spent much of your youth following roving fairs and carnivals, performing odd jobs for musicians and acrobats in exchange for lessons. You may have learned how to walk a tightrope, how to play a lute in a distinct style, or how to recite poetry with impeccable diction. To this day, you thrive on applause and long for the stage.

items.name: Tool Proficiency:
items.entry: Choose one kind of {@item Musical Instrument|XPHB}

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Musical Instrument|XPHB} (same as above), {@item Costume|XPHB|2 Costumes}, {@item Mirror|XPHB}, {@item Perfume|XPHB}, {@item Traveler's Clothes|XPHB}, 11 GP; or (B) 50 GP

background.name: Farmer
entries: You grew up close to the land. Years tending animals and cultivating the earth rewarded you with patience and good health. You have a keen appreciation for nature’s bounty alongside a healthy respect for nature's wrath.

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Sickle|XPHB}, {@item Carpenter's Tools|XPHB}, {@item Healer's Kit|XPHB}, {@item Iron Pot|XPHB}, {@item Shovel|XPHB}, 30 GP; or (B) 50 GP

background.name: Guard
entries: Your feet ache when you remember the countless hours you spent at your post in the tower. You were trained to keep one eye looking outside the wall, watching for marauders sweeping from the nearby forest, and your other eye looking inside the wall, searching for cutpurses and troublemakers.

items.name: Tool Proficiency:
items.entry: Choose one kind of {@item Gaming Set|XPHB}

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Spear|XPHB}, {@item Light Crossbow|XPHB}, 20 {@item Bolt|XPHB|Bolts}, {@item Gaming Set|XPHB} (same as above), {@item Hooded Lantern|XPHB}, {@item Manacles|XPHB}, {@item Quiver|XPHB}, {@item Traveler's Clothes|XPHB}, 12 GP; or (B) 50 GP

background.name: Guide
entries: You came of age outdoors, far from settled lands. Your home was anywhere you chose to spread your bedroll. There are wonders in the wilderness— strange monsters, pristine forests and streams, overgrown ruins of great halls once trod by giants— and you learned to fend for yourself as you explored them. From time to time, you guided friendly nature priests who instructed you in the fundamentals of channeling the magic of the wild.

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Shortbow|XPHB}, {@item Arrow|XPHB|20 Arrows}, {@item Cartographer's Tools|XPHB}, {@item Bedroll|XPHB}, {@item Quiver|XPHB}, {@item Tent|XPHB}, {@item Traveler's Clothes|XPHB}, 3 GP; or (B) 50 GP

background.name: Hermit
entries: You spent your early years secluded in a hut or monastery located well beyond the outskirts of the nearest settlement. In those days, your only companions were the creatures of the forest and those who would occasionally visit to bring news of the outside world and supplies. The solitude allowed you to spend many hours pondering the mysteries of creation.

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Quarterstaff|XPHB}, {@item Herbalism Kit|XPHB}, {@item Bedroll|XPHB}, {@item Book|XPHB} (philosophy), {@item Lamp|XPHB}, {@item Oil|XPHB} (3 flasks), {@item Traveler's Clothes|XPHB}, 16 GP; or (B) 50 GP

background.name: Merchant
entries: You were apprenticed to a trader, caravan master, or shopkeeper, learning the fundamentals of commerce. You traveled broadly, and you earned a living by buying and selling the raw materials artisans need to practice their craft or finished works from such crafters. You might have transported goods from one place to another (by ship, wagon, or caravan) or bought them from traveling traders and sold them in your own shop.

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Navigator's Tools|XPHB}, {@item Pouch|XPHB|2 Pouches}, {@item Traveler's Clothes|XPHB}, 22 GP; or (B) 50 GP

background.name: Noble
entries: You were raised in a castle, surrounded by wealth, power, and privilege. Your family of minor aristocrats ensured that you received a first-class education, some of which you appreciated and some of which you resented. Your time in the castle, especially the many hours you spent observing your family at court, also taught you a great deal about leadership.

items.name: Tool Proficiency:
items.entry: Choose one kind of {@item Gaming Set|XPHB}

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Gaming Set|XPHB} (same as above), {@item Fine Clothes|XPHB}, {@item Perfume|XPHB}, 29 GP; or (B) 50 GP

background.name: Sage
entries: You spent your formative years traveling between manors and monasteries, performing various odd jobs and services in exchange for access to their libraries. You whiled away many a long evening studying books and scrolls, learning the lore of the world - even the rudiments of magic - and your mind yearns for more.

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Quarterstaff|XPHB}, {@item Calligrapher's Supplies|XPHB}, {@item Book|XPHB} (history), {@item Parchment|XPHB} (8 sheets), {@item Robe|XPHB}, 8 GP; or (B) 50 GP

background.name: Sailor
entries: You lived as a seafarer, wind at your back and decks swaying beneath your feet. You've perched on barstools in more ports of call than you can remember, faced mighty storms, and swapped stories with folk who live beneath the waves.

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Dagger|XPHB}, {@item Navigator's Tools|XPHB}, {@item Rope|XPHB}, {@item Traveler's Clothes|XPHB}, 20 GP; or (B) 50 GP

background.name: Scribe
entries: You spent formative years in a scriptorium, a monastery dedicated to the preservation of knowledge, or a government agency, where you learned to write with a clear hand and produce finely written texts. Perhaps you scribed government documents or copied tomes of literature. You might have some skill as a writer of poetry, narrative, or scholarly research. Above all, you have a careful attention to detail, helping you avoid introducing mistakes to the documents you copy and create.

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Calligrapher's Supplies|XPHB}, {@item Fine Clothes|XPHB}, {@item Lamp|XPHB}, {@item Oil|XPHB} (3 flasks), {@item Parchment|XPHB} (12 sheets), 23 GP; or (B) 50 GP

background.name: Soldier
entries: You began training for war as soon as you reached adulthood and carry precious few memories of life before you took up arms. Battle is in your blood. Sometimes you catch yourself reflexively performing the basic fighting exercises you learned first. Eventually, you put that training to use on the battlefield, protecting the realm by waging war.

items.name: Tool Proficiency:
items.entry: Choose one kind of {@item Gaming Set|XPHB}

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Spear|XPHB}, {@item Shortbow|XPHB}, {@item Arrow|XPHB|20 Arrows}, {@item Gaming Set|XPHB} (same as above), {@item Healer's Kit|XPHB}, {@item Quiver|XPHB}, {@item Traveler's Clothes|XPHB}, 14 GP; or (B) 50 GP

background.name: Wayfarer
entries: You grew up on the streets surrounded by similarly ill-fated castoffs, a few of them friends and a few of them rivals. You slept where you could and did odd jobs for food. At times, when the hunger became unbearable, you resorted to theft. Still, you never lost your pride and never abandoned hope. Fate is not yet finished with you.

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Dagger|XPHB|2 Daggers}, {@item Thieves' Tools|XPHB}, {@item Gaming Set|XPHB} (any), {@item Bedroll|XPHB}, {@item Pouch|XPHB|2 Pouches}, {@item Traveler's Clothes|XPHB}, 16 GP; or (B) 50 GP

sizeEntry.name: Size:
entries: Medium (about 4-7 feet tall)

entries.name: Celestial Resistance
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Necrotic damage and Radiant damage.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You have {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} with a range of 60 feet.

entries.name: Healing Hands
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you touch a creature and roll a number of d4s equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}. The creature regains a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the total rolled. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Light Bearer
entries: You know the {@spell Light|XPHB} cantrip. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for it.

entries.name: Celestial Revelation
entries: When you reach character level 3, you can transform as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} using one of the options below (choose the option each time you transform). The transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you end it (no action required). Once you transform, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

Once on each of your turns before the transformation ends, you can deal extra damage to one target when you deal damage to it with an attack or a spell. The extra damage equals your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, and the extra damage's type is either Necrotic for Necrotic Shroud or Radiant for Heavenly Wings and Inner Radiance.
Here are the transformation options:

items.name: Heavenly Wings
entries: Two spectral wings sprout from your back temporarily. Until the transformation ends, you have a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}.

items.name: Inner Radiance
entries: Searing light temporarily radiates from your eyes and mouth. For the duration, you shed {@variantrule Bright Light|XPHB} in a 10-foot radius and {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} for an additional 10 feet, and at the end of each of your turns, each creature within 10 feet of you takes Radiant damage equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}.

items.name: Necrotic Shroud
entries: Your eyes briefly become pools of darkness, and flightless wings sprout from your back temporarily. Creatures other than your allies within 10 feet of you must succeed on a Charisma saving throw ({@dc 8} plus your Charisma modifier and {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}) or have the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the end of your next turn.

sizeEntry.name: Size:
entries: Medium (about 5-7 feet tall)

entries.name: Lunar Vision
entries: You can see in dim light within 120 feet as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can discern color in darkness, unlike most {@sense Darkvision|XPHB}.

entries.name: Celestial Magic
entries: You know the {@spell Light|XPHB} cantrip. At 3rd level, you can cast {@spell Moonbeam|XPHB} once per long rest. At 5th level, you can cast {@spell Misty Step|XPHB} once per long rest. Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells, chosen when you select this species.

entries.name: Ethereal Balance
entries: The moon's cycles grant you resilience and clarity. You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|Saving Throws} against being {@condition Blinded|XPHB}, and you are {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB|Immune} to magical sleep.

entries.name: Phases of the Moon
entries: Your connection to the moon's cycles influences your magic. At the end of a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, choose one of the phases of the moon from the Moon Phase table to influence your abilities.

entries.caption: Moon Phase
rows: Gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your level plus your Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma, determined by your Celestial Magic trait. These hit points last until expended or until your next {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

Once before your next {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can call upon the power of the moon to gain a +1 bonus to {@variantrule Attack Roll|XPHB|Attack Rolls} made with ranged weapons or {@variantrule Spell Attack|XPHB|Spell Attacks} for 1 minute.

When you hit a creature with a {@variantrule Spell Attack|XPHB|Spell} or {@variantrule Weapon Attack|XPHB}, you can impose {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on its next {@variantrule Attack Roll|XPHB}. You may do this a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, losing all unspent uses at the start of your next {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

sizeEntry.name: Size:
entries: Medium (about 5-7 feet tall)

entries.name: Draconic Ancestry
entries: Your lineage stems from a dragon progenitor. Choose the kind of dragon from the Draconic Ancestors table. Your choice affects your Breath Weapon and {@variantrule Damage|XPHB} {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} traits as well as your appearance.

entries.name: Breath Weapon
entries: When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with an exhalation of magical energy in either a 15-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone} or a 30-foot {@variantrule Line [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Line} that is 5 feet wide (choose the shape each time). Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw ({@dc 8} plus your Constitution modifier and {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}). On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 1d10} damage of the type determined by your Draconic Ancestry trait. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage. This damage increases by {@damage 1d10} when you reach character levels 5 ({@damage 2d10}), 11 ({@damage 3d10}), and 17 ({@damage 4d10}).
You can use this Breath Weapon a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma is your ability modifier for your breath weapon, chosen when selecting this species.

entries.name: Damage Resistance
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to the damage type determined by your Draconic Ancestry trait.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You have {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} with a range of 60 feet.

entries.name: Draconic Flight
entries: When you reach character level 5, you can channel draconic magic to give yourself temporary flight. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you sprout spectral wings on your back that last for 10 minutes or until you retract the wings (no action required) or have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition. During that time, you have a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}. Your wings appear to be made of the same energy as your Breath Weapon. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

items.name: Breath Weapon
entries: When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with an exhalation of magical energy in either a 15-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone} or a 30-foot {@variantrule Line [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Line} that is 5 feet wide (choose the shape each time). Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw ({@dc 8} plus your Constitution modifier and {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}). On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 1d10} {{damageType}} damage. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage. This damage increases by {@damage 1d10} when you reach character levels 5 ({@damage 2d10}), 11 ({@damage 3d10}), and 17 ({@damage 4d10}).
You can use this Breath Weapon a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma is your ability modifier for your breath weapon, chosen when selecting this species.

items.name: Damage Resistance
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to {{damageType}} damage.

sizeEntry.name: Size:
entries: Medium (about 4-5 feet tall)

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You have {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} with a range of 60 feet.

entries.name: Dwarven Resilience
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Poison damage. You also have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws you make to avoid or end the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition.

entries.name: Dwarven Toughness
entries: Your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 again whenever you gain a level.

entries.name: Dwarven Heritage
entries: Pick one of the below Dwarven Heritages, you are granted additional traits dependent on your choice.

items: {@b Enhanced Darkvision.} You have {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} with a range of 120 feet.

{@b Tool Expertise.} Select one tool you are {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|proficient} with, your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} is now doubled for any ability check you make that uses your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB} with that tool.
{@b Enhanced Tool Proficiency.} You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB} with {@item Smith's Tools|XPHB}.

{@b Enhanced Smith Combat Training.} You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB} with 2 {@filter simple or martial weapons|items|source=xphb|category=basic|type=martial weapon;simple weapon} of your choice.

items.name: Enhanced Darkvision
entries: You have {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} with a range of 120 feet.

items.name: Tool Expertise
entries: Select one tool you are {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|proficient} with, your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} is now doubled for any ability check you make that uses your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB} with that tool.

items.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB} with {@item Smith's Tools|XPHB}.

items.name: Smith Combat Training
entries: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB} with 2 {@filter simple or martial weapons|items|source=xphb|category=basic|type=martial weapon;simple weapon} of your choice.

sizeEntry.name: Size:
entries: Small (about 2-5 feet tall) or Medium (about 5-7 feet tall), chosen when you select this species

entries.name: Season
entries: The season an Eladrin is born determines their appearance and their abilities. Choose your season or roll on the Eladrin Seasons table. Your Seasonal Slumber trait lets you change your season:

entries.caption: Eladrin Seasons
rows: {@b Spring}: Cheerfulness and celebration, marked by merriment and hope as winter's sorrow passes.
{@b Summer}: Boldness and aggression, a time of unfettered energy and calls to action.
{@b Autumn}: Peace and goodwill, when summer's harvest is shared with all.
{@b Winter}: Contemplation and dolor, when the vibrant energy of the world slumbers.

entries.name: Seasonal Slumber
entries: Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can change your season, and you can gain two proficiencies that you don't have, each one with a weapon or a tool of your choice selected from the Player's Handbook. These proficiencies last until you next finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Natural Heritage
entries: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB} in {@skill Nature}. If you already are proficient in Nature you gain expertise instead.

entries.name: Spiritual Courage
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|Saving Throws} you make to avoid or end the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition on yourself.

entries.name: Seasonal Step
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

When you reach 3rd level, your Seasonal Step gains an additional effect based on your season; if the effect requires a {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB}, the DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma modifier (choose when you select this species):

items.name: Spring.
items.entry: When you use your Seasonal Step, you can touch one willing creature within 5 feet of you. That creature then teleports instead of you, appearing in an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you.

items.name: Summer.
items.entry: Immediately after you use your Seasonal Step, each creature of your choice that you can see within 5 feet of you takes fire damage equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}.

items.name: Autumn.
items.entry: Immediately after you use your Seasonal Step, up to two creatures of your choice that you can see within 10 feet of you must succeed on a Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB} or be {@condition Charmed|XPHB} by you for 1 minute, or until you or your companions deal any damage to the creatures.

items.name: Winter.
items.entry: When you use your Seasonal Step, one creature of your choice that you can see within 5 feet of you before you teleport must succeed on a Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB} or be {@condition Frightened|XPHB} of you until the end of your next turn.

sizeEntry.name: Size:
entries: Medium (about 5-8 feet tall)

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You have {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} with a range of 60 feet.

entries.name: Arcane Ancestry
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|Saving Throws} you make to avoid or end the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition.

entries.name: Keen Senses
entries: You have {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB} in the {@skill Insight}, {@skill Perception}, or {@skill Survival} skill.

entries.name: Trance
entries: You don't need to sleep, and magic can't put you to sleep. You can finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} in 4 hours if you spend those hours in a trancelike meditation, during which you retain consciousness.

entries.name: Elven Lineages
entries: Pick one of the below Elven Lineages, you are granted additional traits dependent on your choice.

items: {@b Enhanced Cantrip.} You know the {@spell Prestidigitation|XPHB} cantrip. Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can replace that cantrip with a different {@filter cantrip from the Wizard spell list|spells|level=0|source=xphb|class=Wizard}. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for the spells you cast with this trait.

{@b Magical Aptitude.} When you use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to make an {@skill Arcana} check to identify spells being cast you may do so with {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}. You may grant yourself {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} in this was a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} per {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

{@b Forest Elf Training.} You have proficiency with the {@item longsword|XPHB}, {@item shortsword|XPHB}, {@item shortbow|XPHB}, and {@item longbow|XPHB}. You also know the {@spell Druidcraft|XPHB} cantrip.

{@b Mask of the Wild.} Your base walking speed increases to 35 feet and you can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.

items.name: Cantrip
entries: You know the {@spell Prestidigitation|XPHB} cantrip. Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can replace that cantrip with a different {@filter cantrip from the Wizard spell list|spells|level=0|source=xphb|class=Wizard}. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for the spells you cast with this trait.

items.name: Magical Aptitude
entries: When you use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to make an {@skill Arcana} check to identify spells being cast you may do so with {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}. You may grant yourself {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} in this was a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} per {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

items.name: Forest Elf Training
entries: You have proficiency with the {@item longsword|XPHB}, {@item shortsword|XPHB}, {@item shortbow|XPHB}, and {@item longbow|XPHB}. You also know the {@spell Druidcraft|XPHB} cantrip.

items.name: Mask of the Wild
entries: Your base walking speed increases to 35 feet and you can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.

sizeEntry.name: Size:
entries: Medium (about 4-6 feet tall)

entries.name: Powerful Hooves
entries: You can easily jump up to 20 feet plus your strength score with a running start.

entries.name: Mighty Horns
entries: Your horns are natural melee weapons, which you can use a {@action Utilize|XPHB} action to make unarmed strike with. If you hit with them, you deal piercing damage equal to {@damage 1d6} + your Strength modifier instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.
This damage increases by {@damage 1d6} when you reach character levels 5 (2d6), 11 (3d6), and 17 (4d6).

entries.name: Using Your head
entries: Immediately after you move at least 30 feet on your turn, you can make one melee attack with your horns as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

entries.name: Natural Affinity
entries: Your connection to nature gives you an intuitive connection to the natural world and the animals within it. You therefore have {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB} in one of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Animal Handling}, {@skill Medicine}, {@skill Nature}, or {@skill Survival}.

sizeEntry.name: Size:
entries: Medium (about 6-7 feet tall)

entries.name: Firbolg Magic
entries: You can cast {@spell Detect Magic|XPHB} and {@spell Disguise Self|XPHB} with this trait. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for the spells you cast with this trait, selected when you choose this species.

Once you cast either spell, you can’t cast it again with this trait until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. When you use this version of {@spell Disguise Self|XPHB}, you can seem up to 3 feet shorter than normal, allowing you to more easily blend in with humans and elves.

entries.name: Hidden Step
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can magically turn {@condition Invisible|XPHB} until the start of your next turn or until you attack, make a damage roll, or force someone to make a {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB}. Once you use this trait, you can’t use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Speech of Beast and Leaf
entries: You have the ability to communicate in a limited manner with beasts and plants. They can understand the meaning of your words, though you have no special ability to understand them in return. You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on all Charisma checks you make to influence them.

entries.name: Forest Guardian’s Strength
entries: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB} in the {@skill Athletics} skill. Additionally, you count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

sizeEntry.name: Size:
entries: Small (about 2-4 feet tall) or Medium (4-7 feet tall), chosen when you select this species

entries.name: Fungril Network
entries: You can use a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to cast the {@spell Speak with Plants|XPHB} spell once per {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} without expending a spell slot. Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for it, chosen when selecting this species.

entries.name: Death Connection
entries: You can use an {@action Influence|XPHB} action to touch a corpse that died within the past 24 hours and extract a memory relating to one of the following emotions: Anger, Fear, Happiness, Sadness. Once a corpse has had a memory extracted, they cannot be interacted with via death connection again.

entries.name: Mycelial Restoration
entries: Whenever you or another creature rolls a 1 on a die roll that restores your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you can reroll the die. You must use the new roll.

entries.name: Fungal Alchemy
entries: You have an innate understanding of alchemy, often using your own spores as ingredients. You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB} in {@item Alchemist's Supplies|XPHB}.

entries.name: Fungril Formations
entries: Pick one of the below Fungril Formations, you are granted additional traits dependent on your choice.

items: {@b Flatcap.} As a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to taking damage from a melee {@variantrule Weapon Attack|XPHB} you may lower your head, softening the blow against your springy cap. You may reduce the Bludgeoning, Piercing or Slashing damage from an attack by {@dice 1d6} + your level.
{@b Spore Shredder.} You know the {@spell Poison Spray|XPHB} cantrip. Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for it, chosen when selecting this formation.

items.name: Fungril Formations (Flatcap)
entries: As a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to taking damage from a melee {@variantrule Weapon Attack|XPHB} you may lower your head, softening the blow against your springy cap. You may reduce the Bludgeoning, Piercing or Slashing damage from an attack by {@dice 1d6} + your level.

items.name: Fungril Formations (Spore Shredder)
entries: You know the {@spell Poison Spray|XPHB} cantrip. Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for it, chosen when selecting this formation.

sizeEntry.name: Size:
entries: Small (about 3-4 feet tall)

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You have {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} with a range of 60 feet.

entries.name: Gnomish Cunning
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|Saving Throws}.

entries.name: Illusionist
entries: You know the {@spell Minor Illusion|XPHB} cantrip.

entries.name: Forest Consultation
entries: You always have the {@spell Speak with Animals|XPHB} spell prepared. You can cast it without a spell slot a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also use any spell slots you have to cast the spell.

sizeEntry.name: Size:
entries: Small (about 3-4 feet tall)

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You have {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} with a range of 60 feet.

entries.name: Gnomish Cunning
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|Saving Throws}.

entries.name: Tinkerer
entries: You know the {@spell Mending|XPHB} and {@spell Prestidigitation|XPHB} cantrips.

In addition, you can spend 10 minutes casting {@spell Prestidigitation|XPHB} to create a Tiny clockwork device (AC 5,1 HP), such as a toy, fire starter, or music box. When you create the device, you determine its function by choosing one effect from {@spell Prestidigitation|XPHB}; the device produces that effect whenever you or another creature takes a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to activate it with a touch.

If the chosen effect has options within it, you choose one of those options for the device when you create it. For example, if you choose the spell's ignite-extinguish effect, you determine whether the device ignites or extinguishes fire; the device doesn't do both. You can have three such devices in existence at a time, and each falls apart 8 hours after its creation or when you dismantle it with a touch as a {@action Utilize|XPHB} action.

sizeEntry.name: Size:
entries: Medium (about 7-9 feet tall)

entries.name: Giant Ancestry
entries: You are descended from Giants. Choose one of the Ancestry benefits from the Goliath Ancestries table - a supernatural boon from your ancestry; you can use the chosen benefit a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.caption: Goliath Ancestries
rows: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.
When you hit a target with an {@variantrule Attack Roll|XPHB} and deal damage to it, you can also deal {@damage 1d10} Fire damage to that target.

When you hit a target with an {@variantrule Attack Roll|XPHB} and deal damage to it, you can also deal {@damage 1d6} Cold damage to that target and reduce its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} by 10 feet until the start of your next turn.
When you hit a Large or smaller creature with an {@variantrule Attack Roll|XPHB} and deal damage to it, you can give that target the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.
When you take damage, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to roll {@dice 1d12}. Add your Constitution modifier to the number rolled and reduce the damage by that total.
When you take damage from a creature within 60 feet of you, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to deal {@damage 1d8} Thunder damage to that creature.

entries.name: Large Form
entries: Starting at character level 5, you can change your size to Large as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} if you're in a big enough space. This transformation lasts for 10 minutes or until you end it (no action required). For that duration, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Strength checks, and your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} increases by 10 feet. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on any {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB} you make to end the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition. You also count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity.

entries.name: Skin of Stone
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Cold damage.

sizeEntry.name: Size:
entries: Small (about 2-3 feet tall)

entries.name: Brave
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|Saving Throws} you make to avoid or end the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition.

entries.name: Halfling Nimbleness
entries: You can move through the space of any creature that is a size larger than you, but you can't stop in the same space.

entries.name: Luck
entries: When you roll a 1 on a d20 of a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, you can reroll the die, and you must use the new roll.

entries.name: Naturally Stealthy
entries: You can take the {@action Hide|XPHB} action even when you are obscured only by a creature that is at least one size larger than you.

sizeEntry.name: Size:
entries: Small (about 3-5 feet tall) or Medium (about 5-7 feet tall), chosen when you select this species

entries.name: Resourceful
entries: You gain {@variantrule Heroic Inspiration|XPHB} whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Skillful
entries: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB} in one skill of your choice.

entries.name: Versatile
entries: You gain an {@filter Origin feat|feats|category=o} of your choice. {@feat Skilled|XPHB} is recommended.

sizeEntry.name: Size:
entries: Small (about 2-4 feet tall) or Medium (about 4-6 feet tall), chosen when you select this species

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You have {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} with a range of 60 feet.

entries.name: Feline Instincts
entries: Whenever you fail a Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB}, you can reroll the die. You must take the new result. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} per {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Sharpened Claws
entries: When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with a swipe of your claws on a creature within 5 feet of you. The creature must make a Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB} (DC 8 plus your dexterity modifier and {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}). On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 2d4} Slashing damage and cannot take {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB|Reactions} until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Nimble Reactions
entries: When you suffer fall damage, reduce the total damage taken by 1 for each 10 feet you fell to a maximum of 20 damage. When you land if you fell less than 50 feet you do not suffer the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition. This feature cannot reduce falling damage below 1.

sizeEntry.name: Size:
entries: Medium (about 6-7 feet tall)

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You have {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} with a range of 120 feet.

entries.name: Adrenaline Rush
entries: You can take the {@action Dash|XPHB} action as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. When you do so, you gain a number of {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}.

You can use this trait a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Relentless Endurance
entries: When you are reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} instead. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

sizeEntry.name: Size:
entries: Small (about 2-3 feet tall)

entries.name: Long Tongue
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} you can use your long tongue to grab onto creatures or obhects within 30 feet of you. You can then pull yourself into an unoccupied space within 5ft of your target. You may do so a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}. Regaining all uses upon completing a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries: You can breathe underwater and have a {@variantrule Swim Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}.

entries.name: Slippery Skin
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@skill Athletics} or {@skill Acrobatics} checks to escape from being {@condition Grappled|XPHB} or {@condition Restrained|XPHB}.

entries.name: Keen Senses
entries: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB} with the {@skill Perception} skill.

sizeEntry.name: Size:
entries: Medium (about 4-5 feet tall)

entries.name: Climbing Grip
entries: You have a {@variantrule Climb Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}.

entries.name: Acrobatic Mastery
entries: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB} in either {@skill Acrobatics} or {@skill Athletics}.

entries.name: Natural Artisan
entries: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB} in one set of {@filter artisan's tools|items|source=xphb|miscellaneous=mundane|type=artisan's tools} of your choice.

entries.name: Prehensile Tail
entries: You have a prehensile tail that allows you to maintain balance and dexterity in precarious situations. When you are in an environment where your tail can wrap around a suitable point—such as a tree branch, rock outcrop, or similar structure—you can use your tail to hang while keeping both of your hands free to wield weapons or perform other tasks.

While hanging from your tail, you can hold and wield weapons with your hands, even while your tail is supporting your weight. This allows you to use your weapons without losing your grip or control, enabling you to perform attacks, cast spells, or use other items as needed.
Your tail cannot support your weight if you are wearing heavy armor or are carrying more than your carrying capacity.

sizeEntry.name: Size:
entries: Small (about 3-4 feet tall) or Medium (about 4-7 feet tall), chosen when you select this species

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You have {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} with a range of 60 feet.

entries.name: Fiendish Legacy
entries: You are the recipient of a legacy that grants you supernatural abilities. Choose a legacy from the Fiendish Legacies table. You gain the level 1 benefit of the chosen legacy.

When you reach character levels 3 and 5, you learn a higher-level spell, as shown on the table. You always have that spell prepared. You can cast it once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for the spells you cast with this trait (choose the ability when you select the legacy).

entries.caption: Fiendish Legacies
rows: You have Resistance to Poison damage. You also know the {@spell Poison Spray|XPHB} cantrip.
You have Resistance to Necrotic damage. You also know the {@spell Chill Touch|XPHB} cantrip.
You have Resistance to Fire damage. You also know the {@spell Fire Bolt|XPHB} cantrip.

entries.name: Otherworldly Presence
entries: You know the {@spell Thaumaturgy|XPHB} cantrip. When you cast it with this trait, the spell uses the same spellcasting ability you use for your Fiendish Legacy Trait.

items.name: Fiendish Legacy (Abyssal)
entries: You are the recipient of a legacy that grants you supernatural abilities. You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Poison damage. You also know the {@spell Poison Spray|XPHB} cantrip.

When you reach character level 3, you learn the {@spell Ray of Sickness|XPHB} spell. When you reach character level 5, you also learn the {@spell Hold Person|XPHB} spell. You always have these spells prepared, and you can cast each spell once without a spell slot. Once you cast either of these spells with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for the spells you cast with this trait (choose the ability when you select the legacy).

items.name: Fiendish Legacy (Chthonic)
entries: You are the recipient of a legacy that grants you supernatural abilities. You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Necrotic damage. You also know the {@spell Chill Touch|XPHB} cantrip.

When you reach character level 3, you learn the {@spell False Life|XPHB} spell. When you reach character level 5, you also learn the {@spell Ray of Enfeeblement|XPHB} spell. You always have these spells prepared, and you can cast each spell once without a spell slot. Once you cast either of these spells with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for the spells you cast with this trait (choose the ability when you select the legacy).

items.name: Fiendish Legacy (Infernal)
entries: You are the recipient of a legacy that grants you supernatural abilities. You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Fire damage. You also know the {@spell Fire Bolt|XPHB} cantrip.

When you reach character level 3, you learn the {@spell Hellish Rebuke|XPHB} spell. When you reach character level 5, you also learn the {@spell Darkness|XPHB} spell. You always have these spells prepared, and you can cast each spell once without a spell slot. Once you cast either of these spells with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for the spells you cast with this trait (choose the ability when you select the legacy).

subclassFeature.name: Oath of the Vanguard
entries: {@b This is a rare subclass, speak to your DM to study swear this oath.}
Paladins who take the Oath of the Vanguard are natural protectors standing as stalwart defenders against any who threaten the delicate balance of the wild under the guidance of the Lord of Storms.
Their sacred charge is to uphold the harmony between civilization and nature, ensuring both thrive in mutual respect.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity
entries: When you take this oath, you gain the following two Channel Divinity options.

entries.name: Stalwart Defender
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can use your Channel Divinity to become a beacon of fortification. For 1 minute you emit a 30ft Radius Aura.

As a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}, when a creature standing in your Aura takes damage from an {@variantrule Attack Roll|XPHB} you may magically redirect the attack to yourself taking the damage in place of the original target. When you do so you reduce the incoming damage by 1d10 + your Paladin level.

entries.name: Intrepidness
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can use your Channel Divinity to fortify the resolve of you and those around you. Choose a number of creatures of your choice within 30ft of you, which can include yourself, up to a maximum equal to your charisma modifier. The chosen creatures gain {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to being {@condition Frightened|XPHB} for 1 hour. This abillity does not remove the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} effect from a creature already affected but does grant {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} to remove it.

subclassFeature.name: Stormlord's Chosen
entries: When you use your divine smite class feature you may choose deal additional Thunder damage instead of Radiant.

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed. Once you gain access to an oath spell, you always have it prepared. Oath spells don't count against the number of spells you can prepare each day.

entries.caption: Oath of Vanguard Spells
rows: {@spell Death Ward|XPHB}, {@spell Otiluke's Resilient Sphere|XPHB|Resilient Sphere}

entries.name: Preserve Balance
entries: Maintain the equilibrium between civilization and nature, ensuring neither dominates the other.

entries.name: Guard the Wilds
entries: Protect natural habitats from unnecessary destruction and prevent harm to flora and wildlife.

entries.name: Fight Corruption
entries: Combat forces that seek to corrupt or destroy the natural world, whether they be mortal or magical.

entries.name: Revere the Cycle
entries: Respect the natural cycles of life and death, understanding that decay and renewal are both essential.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Conservation
entries: You and friendly creatures within 10 feet of you gain enhanced fortitude from the natural world's energy. While within this aura, affected creatures gain {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to non-magical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.
The range of this aura increases to 30 feet at 18th level.

subclassFeature.name: Verdant Rejuvenation
entries: Your connection to the natural order grants you and your allies the ability to draw strength from the earth itself.

As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can channel the rejuvenating power of nature to heal yourself and all friendly creatures within 30 feet. Each affected creature regains hit points equal to 2d8 + your Charisma modifier. Additionally, any diseases, poisons, or conditions affecting the creatures that can be cured by the {@spell Lesser Restoration|XPHB} spell are removed.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Avatar of the Preservation
entries: You can assume the form of a ultimate guardian or the natural Order. As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you undergo a transformation that lasts for 1 minute, gaining the following benefits:

items: You gain a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} of 60ft.
You can cast {@spell Destructive Wave|XPHB} without expending a spell slot once.
Your melee weapon {@action Attack|XPHB|attacks} deal an additional {@damage 2d8} Thunder damage.
All Thunder damage you deal ignores {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} and deals half damage to any creature with Thunder {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB}.
